lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/pompompurin.ui.Pompompurin.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run pompompurin.ui.Pompompurin.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* Represents a command to add a new task (Todo, Deadline, or Event) to the task list.
* Creates a new AddCommand with the specified task.
* @param task The task to be added.
* Adds the task to the list, saves the updated list to storage, and displays a success message.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Represents an abstract command that can be executed by the application.
* All specific command types (e.g., AddCommand, DeleteCommand) inherit from this class.
* @param tasks   The list of tasks to operate on.
* @param ui      The user interface to interact with the user.
* @param storage The storage to save or load data.
* @throws PomException If an error occurs during execution.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws PomException;
* Checks if this command should terminate the application.
* @return true if the program should exit, false otherwise.
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* @param index The zero-based index of the task to delete.
* Deletes the task at the specified index, saves the change, and displays a message.
* @throws PomException If the index is out of bounds.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws PomException {
throw new PomException("Beeboo =( Task number out of range.");
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Represents a command to exit the application.
* Displays a goodbye message to the user.
* @param tasks   The list of tasks (not used).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Returns true to signal the application to terminate.
* Represents a command to find and list tasks that contain a specific keyword.
* Creates a new FindCommand with the specified keyword.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for in task descriptions.
* Searches for tasks containing the keyword and displays the matching list.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
// Loop through all tasks and check if description contains keyword
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Represents a command to list all tasks currently in the task list.
* Displays all tasks in the list to the user.
* @param tasks   The list of tasks to display.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Represents a command to mark a task as done.
* @param index The zero-based index of the task to mark.
* Marks the task at the specified index as done and saves the change.
* @throws PomException If the index is out of bounds.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws PomException {
throw new PomException("Beeboo =( That task number is out of range.");
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");

* Represents a command to mark a task as not done (incomplete).
* @param index The zero-based index of the task to unmark.
* Marks the task at the specified index as not done and saves the change.
* @throws PomException If the index is out of bounds.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws PomException {

* Custom exception class for Pompompurin-specific errors.
* Handles loading and saving tasks to a file on the hard disk.
* @param filePath The file path where data should be stored/loaded.
* Loads tasks from the file specified in the constructor.
* If the file or directory does not exist, they are created.
* @return An ArrayList of Task objects loaded from the file.
* @throws IOException If there is an error reading the file or creating the directory.
// If file or directory doesn't exist, create them and return empty list
// We use regex " \\| " because | is a special character in regex
* Saves the current list of tasks to the file.
* Overwrites the existing file with the new data.
* @param tasks The TaskList containing the tasks to save.
* Represents a Deadline task (a task with a due date).
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param by          The due date of the task.
* Returns the string format for file storage (D | status | description | date).
* The date is stored in ISO-8601 format (yyyy-mm-dd).
* Returns the string representation for display.
* The date is formatted as "MMM d yyyy".
* @return The formatted string with [D] tag and date.
* Represents an Event task (a task with a start and end date).
* @param description The description of the event.
public Event(String description, LocalDate from, LocalDate to) {
* Returns the string format for file storage (E | status | description | from | to).
* Dates are stored in ISO-8601 format (yyyy-mm-dd).
* Returns the string representation for display.
* Dates are formatted as "MMM d yyyy".
* @return The formatted string with [E] tag and date range.
* This is an abstract class that specific task types (Todo, Deadline, Event) inherit from.
* Creates a new Task with the given description.

* Converts the task to a string format suitable for saving to a file.

* Marks the task as not done.
* Returns the status icon for the task.
* Gets the description of the task.
* Returns the string representation of the task for display.
* @return The formatted string including status icon and description.

* @param index The zero-based index of the task.
* @return The task at the specified index.
* Returns the number of tasks in the list.
* @return The size of the task list.
* Returns the underlying ArrayList of tasks.
* Represents a Todo task (a task without a date).
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns the string format for file storage (T | status | description).
* Returns the string representation for display.
* The main entry point for the Pompompurin chatbot application.
* This class initializes the user interface, storage, and task list,
* and runs the main command loop.
* Attempts to load existing data from the specified file path.
* If loading fails, starts with an empty task list.
* @param filePath The file path where task data is stored.
* Continuously reads user commands, parses them, executes them,
* and saves the state until the exit command is issued.
* Responsible for reading input and printing messages to the console.
* Creates a new Ui and initializes the input scanner.
* Reads a command from the standard input.
* @return The line entered by the user.
* Displays the welcome message and logo.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Displays an error message to the user.
* @param message The error message to display.
* Displays an error message for loading failures.
System.out.println("Beeboo =( Error loading file. Creating new task list.");
